extendedInfo.description: Helps manage the logistics gathering everything you need, contacting those closest to you and getting to the hospital for a successful labor and delivery. Meant for the support group of a pregnant woman to assist in the end of pregnancy.An app written by an expecting father for expecting fathers.

reviews.title: A lot of potential
reviews.comment: This could be a Fab app. However, in the section where the hospital details are to be filled in the app crashes. The user is asked to input the name of the hospital, which was fine. However, when entering the address of the hospital, the app appears to try and find street names as the name is typed, which slows it down considerably when you think on a global scale. Eventually, it causes the app to crash. I tried 8 times and was never able to get past the 4th letter of the street name. It also seems to default to locations in the US. I think the app should allow the user to place a marker on the map, which would be much easier than typing in an address, and may resolve the crashes.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Crashes whenever 7 is entered
reviews.comment: This could be a great app....but whenever I try on any screen to enter the number 7, the app crashes. Cannot use when 80% of contacts have 7 in their number. Hope they fix this. (Using Galaxy Note 2)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: What you need, where you need it
reviews.comment: Important features are front and center, but a little polish - like defaulting phone entry fields to the numeric keyboard, and the ellipsis on the remove contact page - would earn that last star.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Crashes
reviews.comment: Also on Nexus 7 the use of the number 7 results in the app crashing, all mobile contacts plus home postcode include this number. Uninstalled. Disappointed.
reviews.author: Ellie Bugg
